headline: Robinhood is getting into banking: CEO Vlad Tenev explains why
summary: Robinhood Markets (HOOD) want to be more than a place where people trade crypto and stocks. The financial services company is launching a new suite of services aimed at private wealth management, banking services like checking and savings accounts for its Gold members, and a new AI investment tool called Robinhood Cortex. Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to discuss the new offerings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Robinhood CEO on Memecoins, Stablecoins, 24/7 Banking, SEC Chair
summary: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev discusses memecoins, stablecoins, 24/7 trading, and the companies new banking chapter including checking and savings accounts. In an interview with Scarlet Fu and Sonali Basak, Vlad says he's very optimistic on Paul Atkins if he were to be confirmed as SEC Chair.

headline: Happy To See Exchanges Support 24/7 Banking: Robinhood CEO

headline: Advanced Micro Devices, Robinhood, 23andMe: Market Minute
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith goes over some of the trading day's top stories on this segment of Market Minute. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is under pressure after the company was downgraded by Jefferies, citing AMD's difficulty keeping up with Nvidia (NVDA). Robinhood (HOOD) introduces new banking services and wealth management services for customers. 23andMe (ME) skyrockets after receiving approval to sell customer data in its bankruptcy proceedings. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Robinhood to bring wealth management, private banking to retail investors
summary: (Reuters) -Robinhood is rolling out wealth management and private banking services for investors with modest portfolios, as the trading platform looks to have a bigger influence on its users' financial habits.  The company said on Wednesday it is launching 'Robinhood Strategies' — a wealth management service with a 0.25% annual fee, capped at $250, for its premium 'Gold' subscribers.  Users with as little as $50 in investments can access portfolios of exchange-traded funds managed by Robinhood's investment experts.

Users with as little as $50 in investments can access portfolios of exchange-traded funds managed by Robinhood's investment experts.

headline: Robinhood, Moving Beyond Meme Stocks, Now Wants to Be Your Bank
